messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@show` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full request path
- /v1/posts/{post}

All methods acceptable?
- false

Allowed methods (based on the routes in the code)
- HEAD: true (implicit via the GET route)
- POST: false (POST is registered for /v1/posts, not for /v1/posts/{post})
- OPTIONS: false (no explicit OPTIONS route)
- TRACE: false (no explicit TRACE route)
- GET: true (show action)
- PUT: true (update action)
- DELETE: true (destroy action)
- PATCH: true (update action)

Explanation
- The routes/api.php file is wrapped in Route::prefix('v1'), so all API routes have the /v1 prefix.
- There are two registrations for the posts resource:
  - Inside the auth middleware group: Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class)->only(['update', 'store', 'destroy']). That registers:
    - update -> PUT and PATCH at /v1/posts/{post}
    - destroy -> DELETE at /v1/posts/{post}
    - store -> POST at /v1/posts (note: POST applies to the collection path, not to /v1/posts/{post})
  - Outside the auth middleware group: Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class)->only(['index', 'show']). That registers:
    - show -> GET at /v1/posts/{post}
    - index -> GET at /v1/posts
- Combining these, the path /v1/posts/{post} has routes for GET (show), PUT & PATCH (update), and DELETE (destroy).
- HEAD is considered allowed because the route for GET (show) implies an equivalent HEAD response in Laravel routing (HEAD requests are handled alongside GET). OPTIONS and TRACE are not registered in the provided code, and POST is only for the collection (/v1/posts), not for the item path (/v1/posts/{post}).
- There is no Route::any or similar that would make "all methods acceptable," so "all methods acceptable" is false.
